newsitem.title: USA: Arco restarts CA. gasoline unit over weekend.
newsitem.headline: Arco restarts CA. gasoline unit over weekend.

text.p: Atlantic Richfield Co (ARCO) restarted a 43,000 barrel-per-day (bpd) gasoline-making unit at its Carson, Calif., refinery over the weekend after repairing a minor leak, the company said Monday.
"As of this morning, the hydrocracker is at 40,000 (bpd) and we're increasing it," a company spokesman said.
The unit was shut late last week after workers discovered a small leak in a heat exchanger.

News of the shut gasoline-unit lifted West Coast wholesale gasoline prices one cent on Friday. Trade ended with spot prices for ultra-clean California Air Resources Board (CARB II) gasoline at 55.50/56.50 cents a gallon, traders said.
